response.job_title: 7x AWS Certified | Cloud Engineer at Nordcloud, an IBM Company
response.skills: TypeScript, Python, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Programming, C++, JavaScript, Linux, SQL, Git, Next.js, Docker Products, OpenCV, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)

profile_positions.description:
Migration of API for communication between client and SaaS platform Sonarqube from Openshift to AWS for a DAX Company

- Creation of pipelines to deploy to EKS using Azure DevOps.
- Creation of Kubernetes manifests for API deployment.
- Responsible for creating build pipelines for docker images containing .net code.
- Responsible for automating test execution according to the established git workflow. • Responsible for the creation and configuration of networks for the solution.
- Implementation of authentication using azure ad for API access.
- Implementation and presentation of SCRUM best practices for project development.
profile_positions.title: Cloud Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Project: SAP Migration

There was a need to migrate applications and workflows developed in SAP to the AWS cloud, for this the different tasks were executed:

- Creation and modification of reports and workflows to meet stakeholder requirements.
- Implementation of middleware to allow the communication of an SAP system on-premise and AWS.
- Export and migration of information stored in SAP to AWS.



Project: Implementation of an asynchronous API and notification system.

Given the strong connection between different domains, it was necessary to create communication channels between the different systems managed by different teams. For this reason, a system of messages, queues, and notifications was implemented to make all the necessary information available to the different teams.


Languages and technologies used: AWS, TypeScript, PostgreSQL,  Docker, Terraform, SAP/ABAP, SonarQube, Gitlab CI/CD.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Magentrack is a startup that provides a platform for the control and monitoring of patients with chronic diseases.

- Architecture design on AWS.
- Web application development.
- Integration of a web application with a mobile application.
- REST API creation.


Project: Load test

- Execution of a load test for the application API using JMeter 


Project: Mobile API

- Creation of an API to store measurements of medical devices following HIPAA regulation, a set of tests were implemented before deploying the application.
- Implementation of a queuing system and workers to process and store data using Celery and Redis.
- Managing peak load at times when people/patients were taking measurements.
- Load testing of the API running on VM in the cloud.


Project: Django app development

- Creation of the data model to store patient information.
- Implementation of authentication system using JWT token.
- Creation of queries for non-relational databases (MongoDB).
- Administration and deployment of infrastructure in AWS.

Languages and technologies used:  Python, Django, Pytest, MySQL, Git, Docker, AWS, Lambda, EC2, DynamoDB.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Designed and developed a dashboard to visualize historical data of software development projects using Python's Dash framework.
- Analyzed data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that helped make recommendations on the most effective developers for different clients and the developers who needed more support in their tasks.
- Prepared data for analysis and visualization using lambda functions, and managed the deployment process using Github Actions.

Languages and technologies used: Python, Dash, Postgresql, Scikit-learn, Terraform, AWS, S3, EC2, GitHub Actions.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer - Data Visualization

profile_positions.description:
- Developing a software for the reception, decoding, and storage in HDF5 format of the data coming from the sensors of autonomously driven vehicles using C++.
- Creating a software for reading and displaying the vehicle's sensors onboard the vehicle.
- Creating an application to automate ECU flashing using python (ironpython and WPF) and PRACTICE.
- Web scraping with python and beautifulsoup.

Languages and technologies used: Python, Iron Python, C++, WPF, Visual Studio Code, Visual Studio, HDF5, PRACTICE, SQL, Git.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Designed and developed an Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR) system using Python, leveraging computer vision techniques and machine learning algorithms. Integrated IP cameras with the ANPR system to capture real-time images for license plate recognition. Utilized OpenCV and other image processing libraries to preprocess and analyze images, extracting license plate information accurately and efficiently.

- Implemented machine learning models for license plate recognition, optimizing accuracy and speed of detection.
- Developed a scalable and fault-tolerant system by leveraging AWS cloud services, including EC2 instances, S3 storage, and Lambda functions.
- Leveraged AWS IoT services to securely manage and connect IP cameras to the cloud-based ANPR system.
- Collaborated with the DevOps team to establish CI/CD pipelines, enabling seamless deployment and updates of the ANPR system.

Languages and technologies used: Python, OpenCV, C++, MySQL, Docker, AWS
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

company.name: Nordcloud, an IBM Company
company.description:
Nordcloud is a European leader in cloud implementation, application development, managed services and training. It’s a recognised cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record helping organisations leverage public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings and sustainable value. As well as partnering with VMware, Nordcloud is triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services – and is featured in Gartner’s Magic Quadrant. 

Nordcloud has 10 European hubs, over 1700 employees and has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects for companies ranging from mid-size to large corporates. IBM announced its acquisition of Nordcloud on December 21, 2020.
